body: What behavior is exhibited by an AI that displays inner misalignment?

choices.W: It will maximize a reward function that is bad for humanity
choices.X: It will not maximize the reward function that it is trained on
choices.Y: It will appear to satisfy human values, but will end up not doing so
choices.Z: It will become less safe as it becomes more powerful

answer: X) It will not maximize the reward function that it is trained on

body: In what classification method is the category chosen based on the categories of a specified number of points closest to the point being classified, by some distance metric?
How many ordered pairs of non-negative integers $(a, b)$ satisfy $24a! = b!$?
What are the coordinates of the two foci for the ellipse with equation $16x^{2} + 25y^{2} - 100 = 0$?
What is the ratio of the number of rotational modes of diatomic oxygen to the number of vibrational modes of diatomic oxygen?
Which particle interaction has the greatest minimum energy in a graph of potential energy versus distance of separation?
answer: Y) Helium atom and helium atom

body: By name or number, identify all of the following processes that may naturally produce a type of glass: 1) Lightning; 2) Subglacial eruption; 3) Submarine eruption.
Within the first 10 kilometers of Earth's crust, what relationship best describes the strength of rock with increasing depth?
The phospholipids in the plasma membrane of archaea contain what type of linkage between the hydrophobic head and hydrophilic tail?

Identify all of the following three statements that are true regarding microtubules: 1) Taxol causes the stabilization of microtubules; 2) ATP is bound to the beta subunit of tubulin; 3) Kinesin moves towards the plus end of microtubules.

A quark's wavefunction is composed of spatial, color, and spin components. Under the condition that a fermion wavefunction is wholly anti-symmetric under particle exchange, the spin component of the wavefunction must be of what type if the spatial component is symmetric?

Identify all of the following three statements that correctly compare an ideal double pendulum and a three body orbit: 1) The double pendulum cannot reach stability while the three body orbit can; 2) Both systems are dynamically chaotic; 3) Both can have uncoupled equations of motion.
Cyanide is a toxin that has the potential for use in bioterrorism. Cyanide works by inhibiting the oxidation of what hemeprotein in the mitochondrial inner membrane?
The Deep Blue chess computer implemented which algorithm, an improvement on the minimax algorithm that allows for branches of the search tree to be eliminated?
What is the absolute difference between $x$ and $y$ given that $x^{2} + y^{2} = 80$ and $x + y = 12$?

A committee of 5 people is to be chosen from a group of 10 people, including 3 men and 7 women. What is the probability that the committee has more women than men, if the choice is made completely uniformly randomly?
Which of the following molecular orbitals displays cylindrical symmetry?
When a crystal lattice of N sulfur monoxide molecules is cooled to absolute zero, which of the following functions describes the dependence of the residual entropy on N?
Because of frame dragging, neutron star crusts can accumulate tension over time, and can undergo sudden corrections that result in a lower energy state. What are these events known as?
The Fermi bubbles above and below the plane of the Milky Way provide evidence that our galaxy might have recently been what type of active galaxy?
The crystallin lens of human eyes can accumulate deposits of protein and cloud up the lens as a person ages. What disorder does this likely cause?
Identify all of the following three actions that are functions of cholecystokinin: 1) Inhibits stomach acid secretion; 2) Inhibits gallbladder contraction; 3) Contracts sphincter of Oddi.

A spring with spring constant $k$ is connected to a block. If there are $N$ number of springs with spring constants $N \times k$ that are added in series with the first spring, what is the effective spring constant of the system?
How much energy, in joules, is stored in a 0.6 millihenry inductor when a 30 amp current flows through it?
ChatGPT uses supervised learning and what other learning technique to fine-tune its large language models, in which the agent is trained to take actions to maximize cumulative reward?
Which unsupervised learning algorithm partitions observations into clusters based on which cluster's mean each point is closest to?

Leonhard draws an infinite snowman by drawing a circle with radius 1, then drawing a circle with radius $1 / 2$ tangent to it, then a circle with radius $1 / 3$ tangent to the previous circle, continuing on infinitely, such that no two circles of the snowman ever intersect. What is the area of Leonhard's infinite snowman?
Peter wants to solve the integral from 0 to 1 of $\qrt{1 - x^{2}} dx$ by substituting $x = \in (u)$ and $dx = \os (u)du$ . Which of the following should be the bounds of the new integral?
What is the molecular geometry of the central xenon atom in the ion xenon trichloride one minus?

For a reaction obeying the Arrhenius model at temperature T, which of the following three graphs of the rate constant k will produce a straight line? 1) k against e to the T; 2) Inverse of log k against T; 3) Log k against inverse of T.
Which of the following iron bearing minerals is the least iron rich by weight?
Which of the following rock has a granitic composition but lacks quartz?
What are the presynaptic and postsynaptic neurotransmitters, respectively, released in the sympathetic nervous system?

You run isoelectric focusing on a solution of three amino acids. Assuming that as the amino acids migrate, the pH increases, order the following three amino acids in increasing distance traveled: 1) Aspartate; 2) Arginine; 3) Alanine.
The Lagrange point L1 appears as a saddle point in the gravitational potential between two celestial bodies. An object placed at L1 would be experiencing what type of stability in its motion?
Order the following three elements from lowest to highest Curie temperature: 1) Cobalt; 2) Iron; 3) Nickel.
Which of the following is a Markov process unable to model?

choices.Y: Events with a continuous state space
choices.Z: Events depending on states before the current one

answer: Z) Events depending on states before the current one

body: In 2012, virologist Ron Fouchier published findings from controversial gain-of-function research indicating that he had discovered a viral mutation that could do what?
answer: W) Transmit avian influenza between mammals

body: What is the value of the sum from $n = 0$ to infinity of the alternating series $\rac{(-\i)^n}{n!}$?

Trapezoid ABCD has point $A$ at $(0,0)$, point $B$ at $(5,8)$, point $C$ at $(9,8)$, and point $D$ at $(16,0)$. A line passing through the origin intersects $CD$ at point $E$ such that triangle $ADE$ has half of the area of trapezoid $ABCD$. What is the $x$-coordinate of point $E$?
The long timescale of phosphorescence is caused by an electronic transition forbidden by quantum mechanics. What intrinsic property of the excited electron changes during this forbidden transition?
Order the following three molecules in terms of increasing chemical shift in an H1 NMR spectrum: 1) Benzene; 2) Ethyne; 3) Formaldehyde.
The Kappa mechanism is responsible for the pulsation of which of the following variable stars?
Kilonovae produce elements through what process, which makes them isotopically distinct from supernovae?
The closure of the Venus flytrap after being touched is mediated by which motor organs of the plant?
The causative agent of ebola belongs to which of the following families of viruses?
Pions are responsible for mediating the residual form of which fundamental nuclear force?

[read carefully] How many times more likely is a particle to be found in the second state than the first state if a wavefunction of the particle is given by $\rac{1}{A^2} [\rac{1}{2}\si_1 + \rac{\qrt{3}}{2}\si_2]$ where $\rac{1}{A^2}$ is the normalization constant?
